vision.notes: As box jellyfish, Chiropsellidae likely possess complex eyes (ocelli) used for image formation and navigation. Details of spectral sensitivity and resolution are unknown.

mechanoreception.notes: Likely possess statocysts or similar structures for balance and orientation in the water column. Also likely to detect water movement and pressure changes.

chemoreception.notes: Used for prey detection and possibly for sensing environmental conditions. Specific receptors and sensitivity unknown.
